main event: Various unidentified object sightings reported in different locations between August and September 1949.
interesting points: Witness reported an unidentified object appearing over his house at Oak Park every 11 minutes, with a bluish-white color and flashing lights.
Astronomer Clyde Tombaugh observed a group of six to eight rectangles of light, yellowish-green in color, moving in a vertical circle path in New Mexico.
Tombaugh, known for discovering the planet Pluto, mentioned that he had never seen anything like the rectangles before or since.
The witness in a letter reported two strange occurrences involving high-speed dirigible-shaped crafts and a sudden flash of light with red and green flames shooting across the sky.

The documents include reports from various locations like Grand Rapids, Michigan; Knoxville, Tennessee; Alexandria, Louisiana; and many others, with evaluations ranging from meteor to probable aircraft sightings.
location: Oak Park, Watervelat Avenue, New Mexico, Camp Breckinridge, Kentucky, U.S. 16, L______ Lake, Alaska, and several other locations
witnesses: Civilians, astronomer, military personnel, and multiple reliable observers
